[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Medical Record System (MRS) defines requirements for secure authentication, efficient data handling, and controlled access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MRS supports secure login/logout, data storage, record tagging, selective visibility, backups, and incremental updates.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MRS integrates with medical databases, authentication, and backup storage services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MRS provides a structured UI for accessing, updating, and managing records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MRS runs on cloud servers, desktop browsers, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MRS utilizes React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MRS ensures secure data transfer via TLS 1.3 and encrypted backups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MRS optimizes storage efficiency with incremental updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MRS handles authentication, access control, and real-time medical record updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MRS supports real-time synchronization, offline storage, and multi-device access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MRS links to authentication, logging, backup, and medical record APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MRS enables secure authentication, medical record access, tagging, selective visibility, and data backups.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MRS is designed for medical professionals and users managing personal records.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MRS requires authentication and backup storage for security enforcement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MRS relies on encrypted authentication, data transmission security, and database integrity.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Incremental Update: Syncing only modified data.
Drill-down View: Layered navigation for medical records.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall support secure login and logout for all users.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize only modified medical data during updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to record, update, and tag medical information (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide structured medical record views with selective visibility (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to upload images and download medical records as backups (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for seamless medical record management (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall retrieve and display medical records within 5 seconds (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store medical records, logs, and user preferences.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication before accessing records.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with medical data security and encryption policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure session security, automatic logout after 1 hour of inactivity, and daily full data backups.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, data storage, backup functionality, and medical record synchronization validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and medical record privacy policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Data encryption standards, healthcare security protocols, and medical record management guidelines.
